projectPurpose: To provide a command-line, self-hosted ADS-B decoder and radar visualization tool using a Text User Interface (TUI).
mainFeatures: Built with Rust for performance and safety

alternatives.name: dump1090
mainFeatures: Outputs raw and decoded data streams
Basic web server with map display

alternatives.name: PiAware
mainFeatures: MLAT participation and feeding to FlightAware
Easy installation via SD card image

alternatives.name: ADSBExchange Receiver Software
alternatives.license: Primarily Open Source (uses dump1090-fa or readsb)
mainFeatures: Feeds data to ADSBExchange network (unfiltered data)
Often used with Tar1090 for visualization

marketPositioning: adsb_deku is positioned as a niche, lightweight, and performance-oriented open-source ADS-B decoder for users who prefer a terminal-based experience. Its unique selling proposition is the TUI radar display, distinguishing it from the prevalent web-based graphical interfaces of most competitors. It serves the segment of users who need a simple decoder or one that integrates into command-line workflows, rather than a full-featured flight tracking platform feeder with a web UI.
